author: jonaburg
content:
hiya guys, followed this documentation for geth + teku merge testnet for kiln https://notes.ethereum.org/@launchpad/kiln
teku, my consensus layer is having issues coming up despite being appropraitely set.
```
2022-03-15 06:50:25.748 ERROR - an error occurred while querying remote transition configuration
java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid remote response: Invalid response received: 403; signature is invalid.........
``` 
does anyone know what this could be about?

author: jonaburg
content: also interesting that we had the same datadir in kintsugi but no longer in kiln?

author: jonaburg
content:
sorry, the earliest error i can gather from says:

2022-03-15 06:55:25.256 ERROR - Execution Client is offline

however, the execution client is running on the same machine

author: jonaburg
content: ah looks like they have teh same jwtsecret now and are communicating

author: jonaburg
content: sorry bout that

author: jonaburg
content: but now my geth execution layer spits out: ERROR[03-15|06:58:45.125] Snapshot extension registration failed   peer=9a2e6f86 err="peer connected on snap without compatible eth support"

author: ajsutton
content: Yep 403 is unauthenticated which indicates a JWT auth token issue.  Glad you got it working.

author: ajsutton
content: You can ignore this - it just means geth connected to a peer that didn't support snap sync.

author: ajsutton
content: Or rather claimed to support snap sync but didn't do so in a way that made geth happy. Either way, it happens a bunch and geth probably shouldn't be so noisy about it. ðŸ™‚

author: jonaburg
content: ah great! thanks! ðŸ™‚

author: king___arthur

author: nico_sz
diegolosada
content:
Hi all!
    
Our Kiln PnP image for Raspberry Pi is live. If you have a Raspberry Pi and want to join the Kiln Testnet, please give it a try.
    
It installs all necessary software, from EL+CL clients to the deposit tool and network configuration. All you have to do is start 2 Systemd services (EL+CL), for instance (Geth+Lighthouse):
    
`sudo systemctl start geth-lh
sudo systemctl start lh-geth-beacon`
    
There is a step-by-step guide for enabling a validator as well.
    
Additionally, if you don't have a Raspberry Pi but own an AWS account we published an AWS ARM64 AMI to run a Kiln node in the cloud.
    
More info here:
    
https://ethereum-on-arm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/kiln/kiln-testnet.html
    
Join us!

content:
Hello EF team. 
I'm using teku & geth pair. 
geth works well. 
But Teku got an error

```
ERROR - Execution Client is offline org.web3j.protocol.exceptions.ClientConnectionException: Invalid response received: 403; invalid host specified (See log file for full stack trace)
```

author: johnydony
content: Build commit is a564429fe4e4098ebfad892234a45faba71d7184 on the master branch

author: johnydony
content: this issue becase of jwtToken?

author: johnydony
content: Fix by myself : add `--authrpc.vhosts=*` to EL client

author: 0xfornax
content: Hey guys, nodes were running ok until this morning when I started getting errors "Failed to update eth1 cache" on lighthouse due to "inconsistentTimestamps". eth1 is running on geth on the same machine, and pretty healthy.

author: metanull
content: No. As long as you have configured the keys for your Prysm client, the validators will start to show up in the dashboards on their own. It will take an epoch or two to show up after your validators have become active. There are no further steps to take. A few of the widgets on the dashboard may still need to be updated for merge-related changes.
